data: Emerging Infectious Disease journal ISSN: 1080-6059 Peer Reviewers Reviewing a Manuscript Peer reviewers for Emerging Infectious Diseases evaluate manuscripts on EID Manuscript Central , which is a manuscript tracking system that allows authors to submit manuscripts and reviewers to evaluate manuscripts electronically. EID manuscripts must be submitted and reviewed through this system. Reviewers log in, read their assigned manuscript, and recommend whether EID should accept, reject, or revise the manuscript. Assessments should include comments on the originality and relevance of the manuscript, clarity of the presentation, logic, and conclusions, and adequacy of methods in the body of the paper, figures, tables, and all supplemental appendices and materials. EID copy editors will ensure that accepted papers are grammatically correct and follow EID style conventions, so reviewers need not to address those areas in detail. Note that EID follows the policies and recommendations of the ICMJE . If you currently have an account in EID Manuscript Central , please check to ensure that your information, including email address and affiliations, are correct. If you have difficulty accessing an existing account, do not create a new one. Instead, contact EID’s editorial office for assistance by email eideditor@cdc.gov . Recognizing Peer Reviewers Emerging Infectious Diseases has partnered with Publons to make it easier for peer reviewers to track their contributions. EID includes the information Publons needs in the thank-you letters we send to all reviewers. 2023 Reviewers 2022 Reviewers 2021 Reviewers 2020 Reviewers 2019 Reviewers Emerging Infectious Diseases thanks the following reviewers for their support through thoughtful, thorough, and timely reviews in 2024.
